item.title: Chris add a quote by Guy Debord
item.description: "Ideas improve. The meaning of words participates in the improvement. Plagiarism is necessary. Progress implies it. It embraces an author's phrase, makes use of his expressions, erases a false idea, and replaces it with the right idea. " -- Guy Debord

item.title: Chris add a quote by Guy Debord
item.description: "In societies where modern conditions of production prevail, all of life presents itself as an immense accumulation of spectacles. Everything that was directly lived has moved away into a representation. " -- Guy Debord

item.title: Chris add a quote by Guy Debord
item.description: "The spectacle is not a collection of images, but a social relation among people, mediated by images." -- Guy Debord

item.title: Chris add a quote by Guy Debord
item.description: "Tourism, human circulation considered as consumption is fundamentally nothing more than the leisure of going to see what has become banal." -- Guy Debord

item.title: Chris add a quote by Guy Debord
item.description: "Quotations are useful in periods of ignorance or obscurantist beliefs." -- Guy Debord

item.title: Chris add a quote by Karl Marx
item.description: "The oppressed are allowed once every few years to decide which particular representatives of the oppressing class are to represent and repress them." -- Karl Marx

item.title: Chris add a quote by Karl Marx
item.description: "[author:Hegel|6188] remarks somewhere that all great, world-historical facts and personages occur, as it were, twice. He has forgotten to add: the first time as tragedy, the second as farce." -- Karl Marx

item.title: Chris add a quote by Karl Marx
item.description: "If <i>money</i> is the bond binding me to <i>human</i> life, binding society to me, connecting me with nature and man, is not money the bond of all <i>bonds</i>? Can it not dissolve and bind all ties? Is it not, therefore, also the universal <i>agent</i> of <i>separation</i>?" -- Karl Marx

item.title: Chris add a quote by Machiavelli Niccolo
item.description: "A man who is used to acting in one way never changes; he must come to ruin when the times, in changing, no longer are in harmony with his ways." -- Machiavelli Niccolo

item.title: Chris add a quote by Niccolo Machiavelli
item.description: "And truly it is a very natural and ordinary thing to desire to acquire, and always, when men do it who can, they will be praised or not blamed; but when they cannot, and wish to do it anyway, here lies the error and the blame." -- Niccolo Machiavelli

item.title: Chris add a quote by Niccolo Machiavelli
item.description: "Whosoever desires constant success must change his conduct with the times." -- Niccolo Machiavelli

item.title: Chris add a quote by Niccolò Machiavelli
item.description: "A prince must not have any other object nor any other thought… but war, its institutions, and its discipline; because that is the only art befitting one who commands." -- Niccolò Machiavelli

item.title: Chris add a quote by Machiavelli Niccolo
item.description: "…he who seeks to deceive will always find someone who will allow himself to be deceived." -- Machiavelli Niccolo

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There are no facts, only interpretations." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A casual stroll through the lunatic asylum shows that faith does not prove anything." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "All things are subject to interpretation. Whichever interpretation prevails at a given time is a function of power and not truth." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Plato was a bore." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Only sick music makes money today." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chris add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The most perfidious way of harming a cause consists of defending it deliberately with faulty arguments." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
